trial_identification.studytitle: Mechanomyography as a technique for the detection of muscle fatigue during neuromuscular electrical stimulation
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Mechanomyography as a technique for the detection of muscle fatigue and correlation with muscular torque during neuromuscular electrical stimulation in healthy volunteers

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Normal musculoskeletal and cartilage development and function

interventions.interventions: application of electrical stimulation (burst rate of 50 Hertz, pulse duration of 400 microseconds during 120 seconds) to the quadriceps muscle of ten healthy and sedentary volunteers and simultaneous acquisition of mechanomyographic signal (amplitude and frequency parameters) and torque (magnitude).

primaryOutcome.outcome: Mechanomyographic parameters (amplitude and frequency) detect or do not detect muscle fatigue
primaryOutcome.timepoint: this observation is performed during the whole experiment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: linear correlation between mechanomyography and torque
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: this observation is performed during the whole experiment

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: sedentary and healthy volunteers with no history of neuromuscular disease

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Rua Imaculada Conceicao, 1155, Prado Velho, Curitiba, Parana, ZIP 80215-901

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Rua Imaculada Conceicao, 1155, Prado Velho, Curitiba, Parana, ZIP 80215-901

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The main purpose is to determine whether mechanomyography signals suffer significant changes during fatiguing muscle contractions.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Comite de Etica em Pesquisa com Seres Humanos da PUCPR
